Reviews.Title: Great desktop replacement
Reviews.Author: Disappointed "cbudsdad"
Reviews.Content: My desktop fried after 4 years, and decided to look into this 17" HP laptop.It's been 2 months since purchase and each time I log in, I pat myself on the back for making such a good choice.Great screen size,not too heavy,and powerful enough unless your head over heels into gaming. The case is classy,the screen is clear & sharp,and the Intel I-series processor is fast,really fast. If you are thinking about a laptop,do not overlook this one.

Reviews.Title: Great Laptop!
Reviews.Author: Justice for Trayvon
Reviews.Content: I purchased this product at Staples after doing a little research on it and finding out that it had all that I need, 1. a large hard dive (500 gb is plenty for me), 2. 17.3" screen, 3. Windows 7, and the price wasn't bad either.  I've been using mine for about 4 days now and I really do love it. It easily connects to wifi without problems, and for the most part once I insert a device into the usb port it automatically downloads the software, so I don't have to go onto various websites looking for downloads.  I also like the fingerprint resistant surface, and the quick tab keys located at the top of the keyboard, which allow me to change the volume, or the brightness level of the screen.  The numeric keyboard to the right, and the full sized keyboard is a plus as well.Cons:The touchpad. I don't really care for it. It's design is flawed in my opinion, so I am using an external one.

Reviews.Title: HP G72 from Staples- Finger Work Out.. Minor Issue
Reviews.Author: Just Browsing
Reviews.Content: Saw a good deal at Stapples last week and decided to purchase this laptop. Not really computer savy but tend to purchase lots of technology and have owned several pcs for work projects including Apple products. As a basic user who tends to search for jobs, read the news online, load pictures, and occassionally download music, this pc has been effective so far. The only annoyance is the mouse pad area which requires a bit of pressure to left/right click things. This laptop seems to be a test run for style because I don't think that mouse pad is effective even though it looks simple. A minor issue in my opinion so just take it as a finger work out. It's also very quiet and the music sounds ok once tweeked a bit. If I could rate it  4 1/2 stars (decent price with the discount at purchase plus the mail in rebate, screen size, memory, but the mouse pad and the starter programs could be better) I would but 5 for the basic user, college student, or the older adult I think you will be pleased.

Reviews.Title: HP - Never again
Reviews.Author: Droidlover
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, all of the wonderful aspects of the laptop do not make up for the problems. The screen is gorgeous, the colors are lovely, the price is right for an array of excellent features. I dearly love my little guy, but he is no longer reliable (this matters to me because I use it for work and running statistical models). There is an electrical problem which forces the computer to randomly shut down (other customers have been told it is related to over heating). After looking up multiple potential ways to fix, I became aware the there are a LOT of people with HP laptops (a multitude of different HP laptops) that all have the same set of problems, including faulty/easy to break powercords.  That is all well and good, expected as no computer is perfect. I also have a macbook and have had problems with it over the years, but Apple has had, by and large, amazing customer support. HP on the other hand is the most awful, deviant company I have ever spoken to. After your 1 year warranty is up, they refuse to even talk to you. Unless you pay them an inordinate sum of money. Companies that do not stand by their products and repeatedly issue products with similar problems are dishonest and I will no longer be an HP customer after this. HP, you have let us down.

Reviews.Title: Nice replacement for a Dell 17"
Reviews.Author: Tom
Reviews.Content: To begin, I have owned this laptop for two months.  I needed a replacement laptop for a Dell Inspiron 1721 (AMD Dual Core 1.9ghz), which stopped working and wouldn't boot up. I needed a 17" because it is my "desktop" and my eyesight is not that good.  To say I got a great laptop is not doing this PC justice.  My Dell literally used to take 10 minutes to boot up.  This takes 15 seconds to get to the login page and 50 seconds to boot up completely.  I loaded the exact same software I had on my Dell.  This is very fast.  Another problem I had with my Dell was overheating.  When I took the Dell apart, there was dust accumulation so thick that there was 70% occlusion.  This HP has been running 27 degrees Celsius on standard apps/web-surfing and about 35 degrees Celsius on movies and game-play(using speed fan temperature monitor).  The fan rarely comes on and runs cool to touch.  It is incredibly light in comparison and the best feature is the HDMI (the Dell was missing HDMI).  I hook up the HDMI to my 32" Toshiba Regza constantly to watch HD content and the transition is smooth and flawless.  Color comparisons are superb with no clarity loss.  The smudge-proof surface is nicely textured and--once you get used to it--the scroll features (vertical and horizontal) are not an issue.  One cool feature is the Synaptics Pointing Device.  With this enabled, I can use my mouse pad in fast-scroll and pinch/expand mode...big plus.  The one problem (small) is that the space bar--when tapped a bit to the right of center--does not always work.  I sometimes have to go back and place spaces between words (thank goodness for spell check!).  Overall, my happiness level is high with this laptop.  Several reviewers spoke of poor customer service.  I can't speak to this, but the new norm is "poor" unless you're dealing with Apple.  In my humble 30+ years of technology experience, companies come and go, customer service comes and goes.  You take the good with the bad and learn from mistakes.  That's why I DIDN'T choose a Dell (this time).

Reviews.Title: Gargantuan screen on a lightweight machine
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "eightrack"
Reviews.Content: A great all-purpose laptop for general computing needs.  It stays reasonably cool, and handles most standard computing tasks easily.  For the student or business person without intense processing needs, this is a perfect machine.Pros:* Lightweight.  For the size of this laptop, it feels surprisingly light.* Screen is huge and bright.  And at 1600x900, that extra space is usable.* Big hard drive, though I may upgrade to a 7200rpm or an SSD for performance.* 4GB of RAM out of the gate means it's not completely useless.  Upgrade to 8GB for the best performance, but 4GB gives you a very usable, responsive machine for most purposes.* Sound quality is pretty good.  You'll probably want some better speakers if you're using this as a desktop replacement, but it does fairly well on its own.* Dedicated numeric keypad is nice to have.Cons:* Video card is standard Intel afterthought. Fine for watching full-screened movies and playing flash games, but anything more demanding than that (ala games at native resolution, or 3D modeling work) will suffer a bit.* Touchpad is integrated into the body of the laptop, with very little delineation where it starts and the body ends.  It's essentially flush with the top of the palmrest, and made of the same material.  This makes scrolling and mousing a bit of a crapshoot, since by feel, it's very hard to know where the borders of the touchpad are.  The fact that the touchpad is not horizontally centered on the laptop (it's skewed to the left) adds to the frustration.  Regular use will probably make this a non-issue, but it certainly is an issue at the moment.All in all, a fine machine for the money.  Get a sleeve for it!

Reviews.Title: My Daughter loves her new HP Laptop from Santa Clause
Reviews.Author: Mart Hyatt "AMAZON BUYER"
Reviews.Content: Before Christmas I researched all laptops at the time and found the " HP G72-b60us 17.3-Inch Laptop PC - Up to 5 Hours of Battery Life (Biscotti)" to be the best buy at the time, $550. It has all the specs of any other brand w/ i-3 Intel CPU, Memory (RAM)4GB DDR3 expandable to 8 GB, Hard Drive 500GB (7200RPM) SATA, with a 17.3" screen. The only difference was the price I paid on Dec of 2010. Santa found it on a sale here at Amazon.My Daughter has used it mainly as a online browser, email, fb, etc. It does well for her usage....Then I tried it on my passion, Zynga games, Mafia Wars which requires several bookmarks and having many windows open while running scripts. I had been using a very expensive Dell laptop with games using Chrome and after opening 15-20 windows the Dell would crash. This HP will run over 20 screens including scripts that drains memory w/o crashing. I am trying to say that it does better than my $1500 Dell so far.I was a little concerned about the HP reputation as being described as many complaints on HP Customer Service. But as of over 2 months of use it performs very well and because of this I have not dealt with their Customer Service. It can't be any worse than Dell's CS.The keys and pad are quiet, no loud clicking and very soft. Long battery life for a 17 monitor. The only thing that I dislike is the mouse pad, as it is not visible and a bit of getting used to, but my daughter has not even noticed. Fan runs as needed but not that you notice any noise except on startup......I a not going to bore you with the specs as they are easily found under product description. Basically the same specs as any other 17.3 laptop that has a i-3 Intel CPU. The only other thing I can think of is that you need to watch the price and try to catch it on sale. This HP model is no WalletMart HP, it's much better equipped.

Reviews.Title: Total Piece of Junk
Reviews.Author: Moneyman
Reviews.Content: Bought this computer in December and after 5 weeks died. Contact HP and they tried to repair it but couldn't over the phone. So I shipped it too them and when it was returned it crashed that day. HP has the worst customer service and are terrible to deal with. Was promised a replacement & after waiting two weeks, no computer and was told they didn't have any more. Then they promised to build one and I waited 2 more weeks and still no computer. So the good folks at Amazon are taking it back and giving me a full refund. So warning to all laptop buyers beware HP is the a black hole for replacement. Thank goodness for Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Terrible design, terrible performance
Reviews.Author: Chewd
Reviews.Content: This machine has problems. For a start the Intel 3-d card is near useless, any 3-d games you may run on it will cause the system to overheat & lock up within 30-40 minutes. I went out of my way to find a machine that didnt have the intel video card (like the 15" version of this same notebook) because intel 3-d cards are not really 3-d cards. Unfortunately i believed the salesman when he told me that this one was configured the same as the 15" model on display... lesson learned, always ALWAYS double check these things before-hand, & don't believe salesmen. I wont make that mistake again.Second the keyboard on this thing is dismal, the sharp corners of the keys will constantly trip up your fingertips, and it often misses your key presses. The touchpad is also problematic as it has the same texture as the rest of the laptops case, there are no borders or lines to tell you when your finger has run off the edge of it & it also constantly mis-interprets your inputs. The machine is also sorely lacking in USB ports, having only 3.Although this machine proudly bears an Altec Lansing badge, which might lead you to think that it at least has some quality speakers, this is sadly not the case. The speakers are tinny & rattle, and as far as volume goes, they can easily be outperformed by even the cheapest headphones.I guess my old dell spoiled me, after using this POS for a couple months, I have relegated it to glorified mp3-player status & have gone back to using my inspiron when I need to do real computer stuff... even though its more than 5 years old now and has half the performance specs, it can still run circles around this sad little HP.

Reviews.Title: One of the best..
Reviews.Author: Joe
Reviews.Content: This computer has been very reliable and has served without problems.  For a 17.2 inch screen, it is very compact and lightweight, like having a traveling desktop computer. I would not hesitate to recommend.

Reviews.Title: Worst laptop I have ever owned.
Reviews.Author: Samm "ThisxisxSamm"
Reviews.Content: When I first got this laptop I wanted something for school work, my pictures and videos (I don't keep them on the laptop, just edit on it), and for browsing the web. With 4gb of Ram and a 500gb hard drive I assumed this would more than do the job. Within the first couple of weeks that I had it, I had to send it out to HP and have the keyboard replaced because my keys were getting stuck and falling off. Not long after I started noticing my battery life was terrible, an hour at most, that honestly didn't bother me as it's too large to really travel with anyways. However, currently I am once again missing keys, my laptop battery no longer charges and even though it is at 45% it cannot stay on without the A/C adapter attached. I don't want to own another HP just because this laptop was such a terrible investment. Now, I don't have a laptop for school and I can't afford to replace this one (not even for something smaller). Overall, I'm very disappointed in this laptop and I would not recommend it to anyone, student or otherwise.

Reviews.Title: Excellent machine
Reviews.Author: Topo
Reviews.Content: Always a bit hesitant to order items like this online but took the leap. It was delivered earlier than expected which was the first nice surprise. Set up was easy and has been working great ever since. Had it about a month now and no problems. Very fast and I was able to load all my previous documents, which was a large amount from various media sources, and still have lots of storage available. Screen is bright and clear. The touch pad is the only issue. Still haven't gotten used to it. Somewhat quirky in that you have to touch it in exactly the right place with exactly the right pressure to get it to where you want it to go. Purchased a wireless mouse which is a great help though. All in all, I'm extremely pleased with this purchase and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Highly recommend
Reviews.Author: Ernie "WardenKeeper"
Reviews.Content: This is my first HP. I shopped around alot and ended up buying this laptop because of the features for the price.  It couldnt be beat at the time.  17" screen was important for me because my eyesight is not good.  The battery life is decent and it came with the new intel processor.  It is a nice looking unit which serves our families needs quite well.  The touch pad takes a while to get used to because it is offset to the left so that it is centered on the letter part of the keyboard. The only reason this unit got 4 instead of 5 stars was because they put both the up and down arrow keys on one key.  Dont understand this idea but it was a bad one. That is the only negative thing I can say about the laptop. Would recommend it to a friend.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME LAPTOP
Reviews.Author: Yolanda M. Schroeder ""Peanut'"
Reviews.Content: I so love this laptop. Being disabled and having limited use of my left hand, I was leary but not anymore. The mouse is a bit tricky but I just use my wireless HP mouse and it works like a dream. For the price it's a really good machine. I do wish it had a dual core processor but that can wait. My main reason for buying this was for school, and my desktop is becoming a dinosaur :). So far, so good. Thanks HP and Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Nice!
Reviews.Author: concerned reader
Reviews.Content: Looking for a notebook computer that you can do real work on and not a glorified smart phone?  Well, this is it... and at a good price.

Reviews.Title: Overall OK. Sometimes network cable connection problem.
Reviews.Author: April
Reviews.Content: I bought this laptop in Dec 2010. Overall, I am happy with the product. The only problem so far is that the computer sometimes does not recognize the network cable connection, then I have to either restart the computer, or switch to wireless connection.

Reviews.Title: Blinq 5 stars......Product 3 stars
Reviews.Author: Kanon
Reviews.Content: The service from Blinq and the price was awesome. For $300 ish dollars this is a great deal. However this PC has some definite issues.The pros are the hardware specs. The i3 processor, 7200rpm hard drive and the 17.3'' bright view display. Ethernet port and card reader. Comes with a dvd writer. Its got a robust feel. Its plastic build, but a good plastic build, it has a nice texture, so no smudge marks.The cons are, a s***ty, s***ty touch pad. Single stiff button, no boundary for the touch pad, no marking for the scroll. Its a heavy relatively thick (compared to an ultra-book certainly) PC, which i don't mind but is definitely not for the faint of heart. Also no Bluetooth and USB 3.0. On full brightness and wifi on, battery life is pathetic, 2-3 hours. However with dimmed screen and wifi off the battery life is about 5-6 hoursSo after owning this PC for about 6 weeks; one star docked for battery life, and one star for the s***ty s***ty touch pad.

Reviews.Title: Contineue to have power problems
Reviews.Author: Jimmy "badlanders"
Reviews.Content: Ive had this laptop for several years and then it started to began to charge and discharge the battery, I thought I have it fixed on my own, but the problem continues to show up every few weeks.

Reviews.Title: Good, at least for a while.
Reviews.Author: Thaddius Finch
Reviews.Content: I got this computer about a year and a half ago, and when I got it, it was a workhorse. It could handle whatever I cared to throw at it with relative ease, which was great. After a couple months, though, the battery life went from 5 hours to just under one, and then soon it would shut off within 10 seconds of being unplugged. I also had to get a cooling mat because it would overheat every couple hours. While it was working properly, it was good for the price, but it died way too fast for me to give it any higher score.

Reviews.Title: laptop
Reviews.Author: Shaun benoit
Reviews.Content: i love my new laptop. i originally bought an i pad3 but you cant play poker on it and you cant do many surveys. those are two of the main things i do and the laptop works great

Reviews.Title: Awful computer
Reviews.Author: holly
Reviews.Content: We bought this for our home computer in 2010 since then the computer has completely crashed, needed a new hard drive and has a defective keyboard. It has a nice, large screen with great resolution but this is one of the worst laptops I've had. We are now having problems with the cursor skipping around at random times - I cannot tell you how many emails I've accidentally sent due to a misplaced cursor. I've owned several other HP's and did not have these problems. This computer is only 2 years old and I cannot wait to get rid of it.

Reviews.Title: By far the worst experience I have ever had with any computer!
Reviews.Author: C17flyer
Reviews.Content: I purchased this laptop rather hastily when my Sony Vaio laptops hard drive died after 6 years of service. Right out of the box this computers performance was mediocre at best mainly due to the vast array of HP programs (gimmicks)that come pre-installed. After about three months of ownership this HP product really started showing its evil and ugly face. It all started with what appeared to be a problem with the video/graphics card and/or its drivers. If you try to play streaming videos from the web with the sound on it will simply crash....every time! After several calls to HP and dozens of attempts to troubleshoot and fix the problems using the HP support programs, I have come to the conclusion that this laptop is really just that bad. Another problem that I have encountered that absolutely blows my mind is its inability to connect to other HP brand products. My wifes father gave her a really nice HP printer for Christmas and it takes 30 minutes to connect to the printer every time you want to print something. This is a prime example of how poor HP products really are, my Cannon printer works every time. After months of being angry at this laptop my wife took it for herself and made me buy a new Dell brand laptop. I am counting the days that it takes for her to finally loose her mind and throw it in the garbage. In a nutshell, this product may be just fine if you use it for simple web browsing and simple programs only. Be prepared for extremely slow product updates, extremely poor tech support, and an endless amount of crashes, reboots, and lost data. I know this review may seem a little harsh but if a zero star rating were an option I would have picked it. Learn from my mistake and save your hard earned money to buy a Dell or Sony.

Reviews.Title: Screen is fried after 1 1/2 years of use.
Reviews.Author: B. Noe
Reviews.Content: After 1 1/2 years of moderate use, the backlight for the screen is shot. I guess this is a commom occurance since you can find tutorials on Youtube on how to replace the screens. (Not an easy looking repair btw).I have an HP printer that started printing poorly after it was a couple years old too.HP will not receive any more of our business.

Reviews.Title: Great, reliable laptop for the price/specs
Reviews.Author: Benjamin Ralph "Ben"
Reviews.Content: I bought this computer in early 2010 afer using another HP laptop for around 3-4 years. The old laptop would get very hot and fan would be blowing very high and then it would shutdown out of nowhere, I assume from overheating. I was lucky enough to find somebody to buy it from me and put that money towards this G72-B60US, and boy I'm glad I did. So far I have not had any issues with this laptop and I have had it for a little over a year. I use this computer as my 'main' computer and mostly for internet browsing, burning DVD's, and converting various video formats into DVD format. The conversion process is a pretty resource-heavy process and on my older laptop it would take anywhere from 45 minutes to an hour, or more. On this laptop it takes anywhere from 18-27 minutes depending on the length of the movie. All the movies I convert are full-length videos anywhere from one and a half hours up to three hours long. So the conversion process time has literally been cut in half, maybe even more. The screen size on this laptop is wonderful and the high-resolution screen is just beautiful. Bright, vivid colors, and very sharp images and video. I did notice the laptop becoming quite warm while performing the video conversions after a while so I bought a cooling pad (Cooler Master Notepal x2) here at amazon and it has made an AMAZING difference. The underside of the laptop is actually cool to the touch if you take it off of the pad, and I literally leave the laptop running for weeks at a time without ever turning it off (I leave it plugged in 90% of the time I use it.) Over the course of this year I have burned over 2,000 DVD's and so far have had no issues with the CD-ROM/DVD+-R. Luckily I have not had to deal with HP customer service and I hope I never have to. I agree with what other people say about HP and them being hard to deal with when it comes to customer service. My last HP laptop the CD-ROM/DVD-R ended up going bad and luckily I was still inside of the warranty window so I was able to get a replacement disc drive after they were not able to fix it over the phone. All-in-all I have nothing bad to say about this laptop in the 14 months I have been using it. I recommend running a good antivirus program alongside a good anti spyware/malware program and you will never have anything to worry about as far as infections or problems. I do not recommend using the antivirus that this laptop comes with. It gives you a 60 day trial of Norton and in my experience Norton uses HUGE system resources and will slow down your computer tremendously. But to each their own, use your favorite AV program of choice.  Here are some things I would recommend along with this laptop purchase:Recommendations:ESET NOD32 5.1 Anti-VirusMalwarebytes Anti-Spyware/MalwareCooling PadUpgrading the default 4GB RAM to 8GB RAM (very cheap nowadays)

Reviews.Title: All that I expected
Reviews.Author: JG
Reviews.Content: Great laptop! Huge screen, fast processor, 4GB of RAM, 7200 RPM harddrive, and to top it all off, the laptop runs as quiet as a mouse. The only con that I can think of, is when the house is really, really quiet, you can hear a feint high pitched noise that can be irritable.

Reviews.Title: HP G72
Reviews.Author: rdubya
Reviews.Content: After researching this subject to death, I landed on this PC due to the screen size, HDD size, dual core processor, light scribe dvd/cd, etc.  This PC seemed to give me all the bells and whistles I was looking for for a great price.I am quite happy with the snappy performance, quick boot, screen size, and overall build of the system.Cons:  Due to the numeric keypad, the keyboard is offset from the screen, which takes a little getting used to. Battery life whill surfing with wireless or playing a CD is no where near the 5 hours, more like maybe an hour and a half.Pros: Great screen, huge HDD, wireless integration is excellent, Windows 7 is very easy to get along with, bloatware is minimal, very happy with the purchase and would do it again.

Reviews.Title: Good 17.3" for the Price!
Reviews.Author: J. Pajk
Reviews.Content: PRO:PriceHDMI OutputCON:Speaker QualityI've had the laptop for a week now. It's a replacement for a Toshiba 17" laptop I bought 6 years ago. Getting used to Windows 7 vs the XP I had. So far I've not issues with the mousepad like some other people. My only complaint is the speaker quality since I enjoy listening to pandora and iTunes, I may just need to tweek the settings those. However so far so good!

Reviews.Title: HP G72-B60US  Laptop
Reviews.Author: Ray
Reviews.Content: Realizing that my Ipad left a void when trying to create content, not just view it, i decided to shop for a laptop. I hated the dreaded Microsoft lock ups and blue screen of death but also prefered microsoft file management. Very impressed with this laptop, no lock ups on Windows 7, very fast and concise.Incredible widescreen display.

Reviews.Title: Excellent service and a great laptop
Reviews.Author: mrmorrow
Reviews.Content: I ordered two of these laptops for my college and high school age kids and received them quickly.  The laptops are very fast and can't be beat for this price!  The same laptop was almost $100 more at best buy. There is no better way to shop for a laptop of this quality. Thanks to the seller for great service!

Reviews.Title: Working Great
Reviews.Author: Richard K. Hull
Reviews.Content: Great looking display, large screen allows you to see it quite easily in varying light conditions.  Love the numeric key pad to the right of the keyboard.  All features and plug in work easily.  Wish the power cord outlet wasn't on the right side.  Not the best spot for a right handed person, puts the cord in harms way of the mouse.  It would be better to be in the back

Reviews.Title: Good design. Bad engineering. Runs too hot.
Reviews.Author: Minh A. Nguyen
Reviews.Content: The thing about HP laptop is that it runs extremely hot. I would stay away. You can go to Bestbuy and compare it yourself. Source: IT Support for 5 years.

Reviews.Title: HP G72-b60us  i3 17" Laptop - Great Value
Reviews.Author: BlueRocker-Orlando
Reviews.Content: I purchased this laptop in December 2010 for my wife who uses it mostly for the Internet, social media, email, photograph fixes and management. The HP replaced a Dell 4600C that she had for about 5 years that bit the dust.  The HP laptop has Windows Home Premium 7, a large 17" display that produces great colors and detail in high resolution. It was easy to set up and has a full size key board with number pad, wireless N network card and plenty of memory and disk space.  The intel i3 processor was a pleasant surprise, providing much better performance than I expected.  This laptop is a great value for the money for everyday computing, I Highly recommended it.

Reviews.Title: Not satisfied
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: I got this one as a gift from my uncle. For a month or so I was happy with this. I was satisfied with the big screen and its visual clarity. There was an electrical problem which caused the system randomly shutdown and I had to lose some of my data. The system runs too hot while using and the power chord  has broken.

Reviews.Title: Just got this laptop today!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Wow - what a deal!  This is a very nice laptop for the price with an excellent amount of hard drive and the speed is amazing!  So far I am very pleased.  I will update as time goes by and I really put this laptop to the test :)

Reviews.Title: After 5 Years Still Running Strong
Reviews.Author: Victoria Cano "Creativinity"
Reviews.Content: This is my personal computer and my work computer and has been for 5 years now. I am amazed that a computer that cost me 500 has lasted me longer than laptops that have cost 1500. Granted, battery sucks, but I rarely use it off the charger, anyway. I upgraded to 8 gigs of ram and every 2 years I do a fresh install. Everything is perfect with this thing, even after all these years.

Reviews.Title: Piece of Junk, Awful Support
Reviews.Author: arbol "Mark"
Reviews.Content: This laptop lasted 3 weeks then crapped out.  Spent several hours on phone w/ tech support before it was officially pronounced dead, now HP will NOT take it back for a refund. GRRRRR!!!  Aside from being a cheap piece of junk, it's designed very poorly - the mouse pad is the same textured plastic as the casing and will drive you crazy, the keyboard is spread out, yet there's no separation between the keys, which means big, clumsy keys that you have the spread your fingers over to use.I had a similar problem with an HP printer 3 years ago, should have learned!.  I'll never buy an HP product again!

Reviews.Title: Excelent
Reviews.Author: Ledif Alberto Morales del Castillo
Reviews.Content: excellent product, I really am very happy with my laptop. because really, this machine is very simple on the outside. but powerful inside ... what I wanted and the display looks spectacular

Reviews.Title: Good and Bad
Reviews.Author: George G. Whitehead
Reviews.Content: The computer is ok.  The programs I need to run on it work.  I wish there were a few more usb ports.  I use a usb mouse because the mousepad is not very user friendly.The main problem I have with it is Windows 7.  Windows 7 will not work correctly unless you're connected to the internet.  Funny how they don't mention that in all the technical details for the computer.Beware!

Reviews.Title: HP
Reviews.Author: Lucretia
Reviews.Content: HP does it again, a great easy to use laptop.  Netflix movies look and sound fantastic on this pc.

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: Aguirre
Reviews.Content: The laptop was delivered at the specific time and everything works perfect.  The laptop is a great help in college with its mobility and speed.
